description: Borrowed from Japanese 空(から)手(て) (karate), from  唐(から)手(て) (karate), from Okinawan 唐手 (tūdī, “Chinese hand”).

entries.meaning: An Okinawan martial art involving primarily punching and kicking, but additionally, advanced throws, arm bars, grappling and all means of fighting.

verbs.description: karate (third-person singular simple present karates, present participle karateing, simple past and past participle karated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To attack (somebody or something) with karate or similar techniques.
